Title: the transporter malfunction

Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon writhes in bed, then wakes up on an alien planet.
Howard’s laboratory. Howard is soldering something.
The apartment. Sheldon is working on his laptop. Spock is looking at him judgementally. He switches the two toys.
Penny: Oh my God, I love this chicken.
Okay, you’re right, I eat your food a lot. How about this, you can raid my fridge any time you want.
He’s bringing me. Who are you bringing?
Hi, you guys got a minute?
Well, I was thinking about Sheldon’s little joke the other night about me eating all your food.
Anyway, I got a little residual cheque from my commercial and I thought, hey, how about I get the guys a little thankyou to pay them back. So, Sheldon, ta-da!
Uh, from Stuart at the comic-book store.
Yeah, it was fun, I walked in and two different guys got asthma attacks. Felt pretty good.
Ooh, am I about to get a rare Sheldon Cooper hug?
You’re welcome. Don’t worry, I didn’t forget about you. Leonard, I got you a label maker.
Mmm. And, I got you a transporter too!
Oh, that’s great. Let’s open it up and put him in there.
Why, they’re just toys?
C’mon can’t we just open one up and take a…
Yeah, yeah, my mom gave me the same lecture about my virginity. Gotta tell you, it was a lot more fun taking it out and playing with it.
That was weird.
I cannot believe you guys aren’t going to play with these.
I dunno. I just think it’s a waste. (Picks up box. Sheldon screams.) Relax. I’m just looking at the box.
What is your problem?
Leonard, I bought you this because I wanted you to have fun with it. I don’t want it to just sit in this box.
Yes.
What?
I didn’t break it. I, I guess Stuart sold it to me like this.
You know, I paid a lot for this. Let’s take it over there and show him.
What is the truth?
Mmm.
Sheldon: Oh, you know what they say, the best things in life are free.
Oh, that’s very kind of you. Next time I have a hankering to wash down a D cell battery with a jar of old pickle juice, I’ll come a-knocking.
Yeah, I hate wedding receptions. I wish the bride and groom would take a cue from Bilbo Baggins, slip on the ring, disappear and everyone goes home.
They had a make your own sundae bar. Ooh, that was a night to remember. Do you know, on the one trip, I just had a bowl of nuts.
Howard, are you having a make your own sundae bar?
Well you should. 50% of marriages end in divorce, but 100% of make your own sundae bars end in happiness.
Quantum physics makes me so happy.
It’s like looking at the universe naked. (Shivers)
Oh, that was no joke. But I understand your confusion as I am our group’s resident cut-up.
Yes.
Knock, knock.
Interrupting physicist.
MUON!
Ah! A vintage, mint in box, 1975 Mego Star Trek transporter with real transporter action. Hot-darn!
Well this calls for an expression of gratitude.
Not this time. Then they wouldn’t be special. Thanks Penny.
Look, it was actually designed for my vintage Mr Spock action figure.
Oh dear Lord. No!
They’re mint in box.
Is someone there?
Spock?
Fascinating. The only logical explanation is that this is a dream.
Was I hit on the head by a coconut.
But it’s mint in box.
Well, I’m not going to dignify that with a response.
To be played with.
Illogical. Oh, damn it Spock, you’re right. I’ll do it.

Oh, of course. Set phasers to dumb, right? (Wakes up in bed) Goody, goody, goody. This is wrong. This is wrong. I’m so excited, but this is wrong. I’m gonna do it. I’m doing it. I did it. Oh, that’s what I always thought 1975 smelled like. One to beam down Mr Scott. Aye, aye, Mr Spock. Energise. (Spins toy). Energise. (Tries to spin toy. It sticks. Tries to get Spock out and toy falls apart.) Don’t be broken. Please don’t be broken. (To Spock toy) What did you make me do? Okay, okay, think. (Sees Leonard’s toy) It’s only logical.
Oh dear. Two suns and no sunscreen.
What is it now, tiny Spock?
You’re the one who told me to play with it.
No. If I got on the bridge of the Enterprise, I would never, ever leave.
Why? I got away with it. Leonard has his toy, and he’s never going to open it, so he won’t know it’s broken. And I have a toy that isn’t broken. Everybody’s happy.
I thought where you come from they don’t have emotions.
You know what you are? Well, you’re a green blooded buzzkill. Perhaps it’s time you beam on out of here.
Very well. Cooper to Enterprise, one to beam up. Energise. (Throws Spock away. Get’s attacked by a Gorn. Wakes up.) Ah. Tiny Spock. Help.
Oh, I don’t want a broken toy. (Switches them back again. Penny and Leonard enter.) Nothing!
Nothing. I said nothing.
Perhaps you should look with your eyes, and not your muscular Nebraska man-hands.
My problem is that I don’t want you to break Leonard’s toy, which you probably did by shaking it. She shook it. We all saw her.
Mmmmm!
Oh, nice job, man-hands.
Yes. Yes, he did, that is a perfectly satisfying and plausible explanation. Yeah, let’s all be mad at Stuart.
Wait. It was me. I opened your toy, discovered it was broken and didn’t tell you.
I didn’t. That was a lie. I opened my own toy. And it was already broken so I switched them.
I can’t because that was a lie. Yours was broken in an earthquake. And that’s a lie.

My Mr Spock doll came to me in a dream and forced me to open it. And when the toy broke I switched it for yours. Later he encouraged me to do the right thing and I defied him. And then I was attacked by a Gorn.
Leonard, Penny, I just, I want you both to know that I regret my actions toward the two of you. That’s a lie.
Yes.
Okay. Leonard, even though I don’t have one any more, I hope you have fun playing with it.
Big fat whopper. I hope it breaks.
Howard: Hey, Raj, you didn’t send your RSVP in. I’m supposed to ask you if you’re bringing someone to the wedding.
Well, can you make it soon. There’s a battle royale going on over the seating charts. In one corner, Bernadette’s mom, and the other three, mine.
Anyway, you gotta let me know if you have a plus one, because if not my mom’s trying to sneak in the doctor who sucked the fat out of her neck.
Come on, who is it?
No, uh, I don’t think so.
Hindus do the same thing. Except they leave room for a cow.
Yesterday you made fun of me for eating lox.
Well clearly you’ve never been to brunch with my cousins.
Nice to meet you.
Yep, one sec. (Puts thing in mouth.) Ah, good. Ma would have killed me if she’d found out I’d broke my retainer.
Yeah. Sure. How are things going?
What do you mean, she’s a lesbian?
Then why did she even go out with you?
Okay, well, so the reason that might sound crazy, is ’cause it’s crazy.
Well, yes. But my compromises are about which bedspread to buy, or whose turn it is to do the laundry, Bernadette’s or my mom’s.
Why don’t you tell your parents you want to try and find someone else, you know, maybe one who hasn’t slept with more women than you.
So you’re seriously thinking about marrying someone you’re never going to have sex with.
Yes, to other gay people.
I told everybody.
Well, actually we kind of agreed to disagree on that one, but we both think you shouldn’t marry this woman.
Her. We thought you two would hit it off.
Raj: I’ll let you know.
Alright, uh, fine, I’m coming and I’m bringing somebody. Uh, Koothrappali plus one.
Who are you bringing?
Wow, what a bunch of Nosey O’Donnells.
I’m not telling. I’m from Asia. I’m mysterious. Deal with it.
Listen, uh, there’s something I want to talk to you about. I, I wasn’t ready until now, but I think it’s time.
No, I’m not gay. If anything, I’m metrosexual.
It means I like women as well as their skincare products.
‘Cause I, I’m tired of trying to meet someone and, I think I’d like you to help me find uh, a wife.
Yes.
Oh yes. In my culture it’s expected to have a chaparone to oversee a first date. Plus I want to make a good impression and, no offence, but with you guys here I look like six two.
Listen, I love your charming racist humour, but any chance you could not knock my religion while she’s here.
It’s different. You’re people don’t worship lox.
Oh, no, no, I get a say in it. But I’m sure whoever shows up will be better company than a threesome I’ve been having with Aunt Jemima and Mrs Butterworth.
Oh, yes. You must be Lakshmi. Uh, nice to meet you.
Oh, uh, these are my, my friends. This is Bernadette.
And this is Howard.
Please have a seat. (To Bernadette) I’m thinking double wedding!
Well, I hope you saved room for chocolate lava cake.
Well, you start off by trying to make chocolate souffle, and when it falls you panic, quickly change the name, and voila! Lava cake.
Well, let’s see. Yup, three missed calls.
I’d like to tell them things are going well.
Okay, what page are you on?
Say again.
Like, dude on dude, but with women?
Why me, of all people?
I’m not gay.
That’s Unbreakable by Khloe and Lamar. And for your information, it’s unisex.
I like to boogie.
W-w-with women. I like to boogie with women.
Thankyou. And once again, my baloney likes girls. Wait-wait. You don’t want to put a bit of that in your mouth without trying my homemade chantilly cream. Yeah, okay, that time I heard it.
Ready for lunch?
Hey, uh, can I run something by you? It’s about Lakshmi.
We hit a couple of bumps. She lives over on Manhattan Beach, so it takes over an hour to get there. And she’s a lesbian.
Well, you know whenever you and I would try to hit on women in bars, and they’d blow us off, and then we’d tell each other they were probably gay. It’s like that. Except this time it’s true.
She was looking for a husband so she can appear to be straight. And you know, it sounded crazy to me at first, but I’m actually thinking about doing it.
Look, Howard, you’re in a relationship. You know you have to make compromises.
It’s a great deal. We both get our parents off our backs. I don’t have to come home to an empty apartment every night, plus, once I’m married, I can finally eat carbs again and let myself go.
Because this one wants to marry me. I might never find another one who does.
I can’t believe your attitude. I thought you were in favour of gay people getting married.
Do you hear how homophobic you sound?
This is a treat, what brings you guys by?
What, you told her?
So, while I’m waiting for this mysterious perfect match, who may or may not exist, I’m supposed to just be alone.
Oh, my goodness. Aren’t you the cutest little Yorkie ever? You got him for me?
I think we already have. Thank you guys so much. Let’s see if you fit in my man purse.
Leonard: Mmm, you liked Professor Guyster’s wedding.
I’m sorry, you are our resident cut-up?
You went to the comic-book store by yourself?
Wow. No, it’s great. Also, uh, mint in box.
Once you open the box it loses its value.
Really? I don’t even notice any more.
Well I told you, you don’t, it’s mint in box.
You know, you’re right. I mean, it’s from you, I’m never going to sell it. I’m opening it.
Well, you should talk to Stuart.
Well, hand it over so I can open it.
Raj (on skype): Hello Mummy, Daddy, how are you?
Mrs Koothrappali: We love you, and we accept your alternate lifestyle. Just keep it to yourself.
And just to clarify, a female wife?
Dr Koothrappali: Oh I’m sure you can. Just give it a minute.
It’s finally happening. You’re coming out of the closet, aren’t you?
Well, if you’re not coming out, why did you call us during the cricket semi-finals?
Matchmaking, very smart move son. Much better than marrying for love.
Bernadette: Are you sure you want us here when you meet this woman?
The nuns always chaparoned the dances at my high school. They used to make us leave room between us for the holy spirit.
So, arranged marriages. The parents just decide, and then you have to get married?
Raj, Howie told me what’s going on with you and Lakshmi.
We believe there’s someone out there who’ll love you for you.
Not necessarily. I think we’ve found someone for you to cuddle with. (Pulls a puppy out of her bag.)
Lakshmi: Impressive. What goes into making something like that.
I bet our parents are dying to know how things are going here.
Four missed calls, two text messages, and a failed video chat. I win. So, what are we going to tell them.
Me too. But before we get their hopes up we should probably make sure we’re on the same page.
I’m on the one where I’m on a lot of pressure from my parents to get married and settle down, and have a family, and I’m going to do it so they don’t find out I’m gay.
I know a fake marriage isn’t an honest way to live, but you of all people must know how difficult it is to come out in our culture.
Well, there is a rumour back in New Delhi that you’re, how shall we say, comfortable in a sari.
Really? The chocolate lava cake? The little soaps in the bathroom? And I’m sorry, but you’re wearing more perfume than I am.
Fill in the blank. I love the nightlife?
That’s disappointing. You were exactly the kind of phoney-baloney husband I was looking for.
Spock: I need to speak with you.
It is not the only logical explanation. For example, you could be hallucinating after being hit on the head by, say, a coconut.
I’m not going to dignify that with a response. Now, to the matter at hand. You need to play with the transporter toy.
Yes, and to open it would destroy it’s value. But remember, like me, you also have a human half.
Consider this. What is the purpose of a toy?
Therefore? To not play with it would be?
Sheldon, wait. You have to wake up first.
I am very disappointed in you. You broke your toy and switched it with Leonard’s. You should be ashamed of yourself.
If I told you to jump off the bridge of the Enterprise, would you do it?
Trust me, it gets old after a while. You must right your wrong, Sheldon.
I come from a factory in Taiwan. Now do the right thing.
Fine. I will just use the transporter. Oh, right. You broke it.

Not this time. Then they wouldn’t be special. Thanks Penny.
You’re welcome. Don’t worry, I didn’t forget about you. Leonard, I got you a label maker.
Wow. No, it’s great. Also, uh, mint in box.
Mmm. And, I got you a transporter too!
Look, it was actually designed for my vintage Mr Spock action figure.
Oh, that’s great. Let’s open it up and put him in there.
C’mon can’t we just open one up and take a…
Once you open the box it loses its value.
Yeah, yeah, my mom gave me the same lecture about my virginity. Gotta tell you, it was a lot more fun taking it out and playing with it.
Are you sure you want us here when you meet this woman?
Oh yes. In my culture it’s expected to have a chaparone to oversee a first date. Plus I want to make a good impression and, no offence, but with you guys here I look like six two.
The nuns always chaparoned the dances at my high school. They used to make us leave room between us for the holy spirit.
Hindus do the same thing. Except they leave room for a cow.
Listen, I love your charming racist humour, but any chance you could not knock my religion while she’s here.
Yesterday you made fun of me for eating lox.
It’s different. You’re people don’t worship lox.
Well clearly you’ve never been to brunch with my cousins.

Oh, uh, these are my, my friends. This is Bernadette.
Please have a seat. (To Bernadette) I’m thinking double wedding!
I need to speak with you.

It is not the only logical explanation. For example, you could be hallucinating after being hit on the head by, say, a coconut.
Was I hit on the head by a coconut.
I’m not going to dignify that with a response. Now, to the matter at hand. You need to play with the transporter toy.
Yes, and to open it would destroy it’s value. But remember, like me, you also have a human half.
Well, I’m not going to dignify that with a response.
Consider this. What is the purpose of a toy?
Therefore? To not play with it would be?
Illogical. Oh, damn it Spock, you’re right. I’ll do it.
Sheldon, wait. You have to wake up first.

Oh, of course. Set phasers to dumb, right? (Wakes up in bed) Goody, goody, goody. This is wrong. This is wrong. I’m so excited, but this is wrong. I’m gonna do it. I’m doing it. I did it. Oh, that’s what I always thought 1975 smelled like. One to beam down Mr Scott. Aye, aye, Mr Spock. Energise. (Spins toy). Energise. (Tries to spin toy. It sticks. Tries to get Spock out and toy falls apart.) Don’t be broken. Please don’t be broken. (To Spock toy) What did you make me do? Okay, okay, think. (Sees Leonard’s toy) It’s only logical.
Well, I hope you saved room for chocolate lava cake.
Impressive. What goes into making something like that.
Well, you start off by trying to make chocolate souffle, and when it falls you panic, quickly change the name, and voila! Lava cake.
I bet our parents are dying to know how things are going here.
Well, let’s see. Yup, three missed calls.
Four missed calls, two text messages, and a failed video chat. I win. So, what are we going to tell them.
I’d like to tell them things are going well.
Me too. But before we get their hopes up we should probably make sure we’re on the same page.
Okay, what page are you on?
I’m on the one where I’m on a lot of pressure from my parents to get married and settle down, and have a family, and I’m going to do it so they don’t find out I’m gay.
Like, dude on dude, but with women?
I know a fake marriage isn’t an honest way to live, but you of all people must know how difficult it is to come out in our culture.
Well, there is a rumour back in New Delhi that you’re, how shall we say, comfortable in a sari.
Really? The chocolate lava cake? The little soaps in the bathroom? And I’m sorry, but you’re wearing more perfume than I am.
That’s Unbreakable by Khloe and Lamar. And for your information, it’s unisex.
Fill in the blank. I love the nightlife?
W-w-with women. I like to boogie with women.
That’s disappointing. You were exactly the kind of phoney-baloney husband I was looking for.
Thankyou. And once again, my baloney likes girls. Wait-wait. You don’t want to put a bit of that in your mouth without trying my homemade chantilly cream. Yeah, okay, that time I heard it.
Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon writhes in bed, then wakes up on an alien planet.
Oh dear. Two suns and no sunscreen.
What is it now, tiny Spock?
I am very disappointed in you. You broke your toy and switched it with Leonard’s. You should be ashamed of yourself.
You’re the one who told me to play with it.
If I told you to jump off the bridge of the Enterprise, would you do it?
No. If I got on the bridge of the Enterprise, I would never, ever leave.
Trust me, it gets old after a while. You must right your wrong, Sheldon.
Why? I got away with it. Leonard has his toy, and he’s never going to open it, so he won’t know it’s broken. And I have a toy that isn’t broken. Everybody’s happy.
I thought where you come from they don’t have emotions.
I come from a factory in Taiwan. Now do the right thing.
You know what you are? Well, you’re a green blooded buzzkill. Perhaps it’s time you beam on out of here.
Fine. I will just use the transporter. Oh, right. You broke it.
Very well. Cooper to Enterprise, one to beam up. Energise. (Throws Spock away. Get’s attacked by a Gorn. Wakes up.) Ah. Tiny Spock. Help.
Howard’s laboratory. Howard is soldering something.
Yep, one sec. (Puts thing in mouth.) Ah, good. Ma would have killed me if she’d found out I’d broke my retainer.
Hey, uh, can I run something by you? It’s about Lakshmi.
Yeah. Sure. How are things going?
We hit a couple of bumps. She lives over on Manhattan Beach, so it takes over an hour to get there. And she’s a lesbian.
What do you mean, she’s a lesbian?
Well, you know whenever you and I would try to hit on women in bars, and they’d blow us off, and then we’d tell each other they were probably gay. It’s like that. Except this time it’s true.
Then why did she even go out with you?
She was looking for a husband so she can appear to be straight. And you know, it sounded crazy to me at first, but I’m actually thinking about doing it.
Okay, well, so the reason that might sound crazy, is ’cause it’s crazy.
Look, Howard, you’re in a relationship. You know you have to make compromises.
Well, yes. But my compromises are about which bedspread to buy, or whose turn it is to do the laundry, Bernadette’s or my mom’s.
It’s a great deal. We both get our parents off our backs. I don’t have to come home to an empty apartment every night, plus, once I’m married, I can finally eat carbs again and let myself go.
Why don’t you tell your parents you want to try and find someone else, you know, maybe one who hasn’t slept with more women than you.
Because this one wants to marry me. I might never find another one who does.
So you’re seriously thinking about marrying someone you’re never going to have sex with.
I can’t believe your attitude. I thought you were in favour of gay people getting married.
Do you hear how homophobic you sound?
The apartment. Sheldon is working on his laptop. Spock is looking at him judgementally. He switches the two toys.
Oh, I don’t want a broken toy. (Switches them back again. Penny and Leonard enter.) Nothing!
Really? I don’t even notice any more.
I cannot believe you guys aren’t going to play with these.
Well I told you, you don’t, it’s mint in box.
I dunno. I just think it’s a waste. (Picks up box. Sheldon screams.) Relax. I’m just looking at the box.
Perhaps you should look with your eyes, and not your muscular Nebraska man-hands.
My problem is that I don’t want you to break Leonard’s toy, which you probably did by shaking it. She shook it. We all saw her.
Leonard, I bought you this because I wanted you to have fun with it. I don’t want it to just sit in this box.
You know, you’re right. I mean, it’s from you, I’m never going to sell it. I’m opening it.
I didn’t break it. I, I guess Stuart sold it to me like this.
Yes. Yes, he did, that is a perfectly satisfying and plausible explanation. Yeah, let’s all be mad at Stuart.
You know, I paid a lot for this. Let’s take it over there and show him.
Wait. It was me. I opened your toy, discovered it was broken and didn’t tell you.
I didn’t. That was a lie. I opened my own toy. And it was already broken so I switched them.
Well, you should talk to Stuart.
I can’t because that was a lie. Yours was broken in an earthquake. And that’s a lie.

My Mr Spock doll came to me in a dream and forced me to open it. And when the toy broke I switched it for yours. Later he encouraged me to do the right thing and I defied him. And then I was attacked by a Gorn.

Well, hand it over so I can open it.
Okay. Leonard, even though I don’t have one any more, I hope you have fun playing with it.
Big fat whopper. I hope it breaks.
This is a treat, what brings you guys by?
Raj, Howie told me what’s going on with you and Lakshmi.
We believe there’s someone out there who’ll love you for you.
Well, actually we kind of agreed to disagree on that one, but we both think you shouldn’t marry this woman.
So, while I’m waiting for this mysterious perfect match, who may or may not exist, I’m supposed to just be alone.
Not necessarily. I think we’ve found someone for you to cuddle with. (Pulls a puppy out of her bag.)
Oh, my goodness. Aren’t you the cutest little Yorkie ever? You got him for me?
Her. We thought you two would hit it off.
I think we already have. Thank you guys so much. Let’s see if you fit in my man purse.
